snippet: A predawn Amber Alert set off cellphones across the city, but a boy and his mother were found after the alert led to a tip to the Police Department’s Crime Stoppers hot line.
abstract: Predawn Amber Alert sets off cellphones across New York City with message about 7-month-old boy abducted from Harlem foster care agency by his mother, who had history of mental illness; boy and mother are found after alert leads to tip to police; while many people see value in getting alert, others are less embracing, but incident illustrates growing reach of vast public communications network.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and Andy Newman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A predawn Amber Alert set off cellphones across the city, but a boy and his mother were found after the alert led to a tip to the Police Department’s Crime Stoppers hot line.

headline.main: Wake-Up Call for New Yorkers as Police Seek Abducted Boy
headline.print_headline: Wake-Up Call for New Yorkers As Police Seek Abducted Boy
